Reviews.Title: “OUR NEW BEST FRIEND HENRY”
Reviews.Author: April M
Reviews.Content: My boss and I were there for a convention and Henry made sure we had everything we needed in every aspect of our trip. From the moment I arrived he ran out to the parking lot to help me with my luggage, and at the end of the show he loaded up our booth belongings and brought them out to our car. He even tried to warm us up with hugs when it got cold in the convention hall!! Henry is a GREAT worker!!

Reviews.Title: “First class improvements and treatment”
Reviews.Author: dayne h
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference in the past two days. Very impressed with the fantastic facelift to the property in the past year since visiting there in 2011...wow...fantastic. And Henry is an employee EVERY company needs....works hard...takes ownership and shows he cares...hope to see him again next year...what a treat to meet him! Thanks Henry, for adding just the right touch to my stay at Marriot....a great stay from check-in to departure.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Ronald W
Reviews.Content: Rooms were comfortable and modern and customer service was impeccable. Henry was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ambassador Henry”
Reviews.Author: Karen W
Reviews.Content: After a meeting three of us attended, we visited the restaurant around 1 p.m. on 3/16/12. Met Ambassador Henry, who went above and beyond to make three of us very comfortable with our luncheon experience. We wanted to eat in the courtyard instead of the restaurant. Henry brought us china and flatware so we wouldn't have to eat using plastic flatware and Styrofoam boxes. We were told it wasn't his responsibility to assist us, but he brought our food out to us and provided plates, glassware and flatware. He even provided us with Tootsie Rolls for dessert. Henry truly went above and beyond to make our luncheon experience in the courtyard a memorable experience. Henry is truly an asset to the Marriott Indianapolis East. He always appeared at an appropriate time to assist us. His timing was impeccable. Henry was always engaging and very helpful. It was a pleasure encountering Henry and relying on his expertise as hotel Ambassador.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Robert G
Reviews.Content: While the actual facility was nothing earth shattering what I found behind the front desk and at the bell stand was as good as it gets. I travel 200+ days per year and rank the service I received from the front desk manager and bell service as best in class. The room was nice, clean and comfortable. The hotel was EXTREMELY busy but within minutes made me and my family feel as though we were the only guests there. I would stay again and confidentaly reccomend to family, friends and coworkers.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you meet Henry!”
Reviews.Author: Aleta C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a convention. One of the first people you meet (or I hope you do) is Henry! He not only helps with luggage at the front desk, but he will help with anything you need. His smile and attitude is contagious! I wish all hotels had a 'Henry' to start you stay off right, and then send you home with a warm cozy feeling!

Reviews.Title: “Great conference venue”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Indianapolis East is a great place for a conference. Having been here in the past, their recent remodeling and building additions have made a once stuffy and old venue a delight to attend. The new addition of the main lobby and public space is light, open, and inviting. The staff was very helpful (thanks to Henry for the assistance on moving equipment/soft drinks) and very polite. The conference rooms are all in the same wing, making the move to other breakout rooms easy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic remodel and service!!”
Reviews.Author: StyneUTZ
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a visit at this hotel and I must say the remodel is AMAZING!! Beautiful grounds, lobby is very inviting and seeing Henry in the lobby was the highlight of my day! Thanks!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, I would come back.”
Reviews.Author: Dansladen
Reviews.Content: I spent the night at the Marriot Indi East while on business. Check in was quick and easy and the hotel lobby area is very modern and well kept. The decor changes as you get to the elevator are where you go back to the 1980's red/gold carpets and flowery wall paper. Room was clean and once a again a mix of modern and old. Nonetheless, nothing was falling apart or broken. The staff is very friendly and attentive. As a Marriot rewards member, i was given access to the lounge where free snacks and drinks are served every evening. In all, I would not hesitate using this hotel again. I just hope that the management considers bringing the rest of the hotel to the same modern decor standards as in the main entrance/lobby areas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not my fav...”
Reviews.Author: paulbahr
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's just me, but it always seems like the higher the nightly rate, the lower the quality and amenities available. I stayed at this hotel as part of a conference being held there. The rooms were small, the bathroom was tiny! The closet door couldn't open all the way because it ran into the doorstop on the main entry door. The bathroom door was an exterior sliding door! Odd.... Beds were comfortable with a decent desk area with wired interned access. Plenty of restaurants nearby. Not sure I'd stay there by choice, but it could just be me...

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gretta1234
Reviews.Content: +Very convenient and easy to find, right on the main road. +The room was very nice everything was clean and fancy nice soap and good coffee. +The bed and pillows were very comfortable and supportive. +It was quiet in spite of the freeway right outside the window. +The hotel has been recently remodeled with a lot more very pleasant public space which was great for our conference of 600+ people. -The only negatives were the view of the freeway right on top of the hotel. -There was only one serving of coffee provided in our room with a double occupancy (King Rm)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn K
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank all the staff at this hotel. After we found out that we had booked at the wrong hotel. Henry Robinson, the hotel ambassador went out of his way to get us a room at the Fairfeild Marriot ( just across the parking lot). He took our suitcases over, we were upgraded to a jucuzzi suite. And Henry checked on us everyday to find out if everything was alright. Dedicated staff like the staff at these hotels are hard to find. My over all expierence was clean rooms, good food, great atmosphere, and Henry will always be in my thoughts as ONE GREAT GUY!

Reviews.Title: “Staff”
Reviews.Author: Pamela B
Reviews.Content: Aside from another group being in the hotel, that was very disturbing... the hotel staff was very accomodating to our group. I do not hold the hotel at fault for the behavior of the large group that was there. All hotel staff were very friendly and helped in any way to make our stay more pleasant! The man behind the counter... Tony was great! All the bellmen were awesome as well! Henry, Clement and Antonio! Thank you for a great time! I would definately suggest your hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay!”
Reviews.Author: Brent W
Reviews.Content: I stay with this Hotel twice a week, and feel like I am at home. The staff treats me like family, and make being away from home that much easier! I totally recommend this Hotel!!!!! Sincerely---Brent

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Incredible Service & Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: GCGA
Reviews.Content: Once you walk in you're greeted by friendly staff and a warm abiance. The rooms were spacious and immaculate. The food in the restaurant was delicious. The morning concierge personnel was courteous and kept everything stocked and very clean. The Hotel Ambassador, Henry W. Robinson was by far, the most attentive staff member I've ever met out of all the Marriotts I've ever stayed in. He was always checking to see how everyone in our party was doing, making sure we had everything we needed, and was able to give us solutions to any obstacles we came across. His warm and pleasant demeanor made our stay! The rest of the staff we came across was also extremely helpful! This was a wonderful and successful business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Dee J
Reviews.Content: The Indianapolis Marriott East provides the best customer service around. I have been a customer since 1996 and it seems that the service gets better ewach time I return. The new renovations have created a very beautiful serene and peaceful environment. Thank you for your Hoosire Hospitality! It's always good to come back home to my Marriott Family.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, questionable location”
Reviews.Author: Bryce S
Reviews.Content: Marriott hotels are operated to a high standard. This hotel has a great interior appearance and friendly staff. Poured concrete type building, although its been updated. The comfy beds and seven pillows you expect. Odd location. Convienent to the Marion County Probation Department and the Wonder Bread plant. Not the type of area with local restaurants nearby. The other Marriotts are probably better located. Pricewise, it's a great deal. For some reason the heating/cooling unit was quite loud at night.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a renovation!”
Reviews.Author: TheBoos111
Reviews.Content: Forget what you read previously about this hotel. Yes, it is not in a glamorous area; this they cannot change. However, their new renovation of the lobby/bar/restaurant area is fantastic and you would think when you see it that you were transported to one of the swankier downtown hotels. When you walk into the lobby you are greeted by a huge elongated fireplace; behind it is the bar/ restaurant/seating area that is very spacious and modern and has several flat screens that were perfect for watching the Super Bowl. The food is great; I am always skeptical about hotel food but I ate there three times. I highly recommend the bistro burger with chips. The staff was incredible, I cannot stress enough how friendly, helpful and resourceful they were. Since I was conducting business at the hotel and not staying there, I cannot comment on the rooms, but I was very impressed by the new lobby, the food and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “I am here for Superbowl and I can not say enough”
Reviews.Author: Jerry E
Reviews.Content: This hotel is NICE !!!! The construction they did to this hotel was well worth it. What makes this hotel even more worth it.....the staff...all of them !!!!! I mean the entire staff could not do enough to help and be helpful with everything. The rooms ..the pool...the outside patio area with fire pits and the food the bar area. A ++++++ job well done. As this was my first time here ...I will be back. You guys should be proud of your Hoosier Hospitalty. Thank you so much for making my stay an AWESOME trip. Jerry Ehrlich, of Philadelphia Did I forget to say. The staff is what made everything even better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, bad location”
Reviews.Author: kerrydchicago_IL
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this hotel for a trade show, forever. The rooms are always clean and comfortable. The noise level is what you're used to from a Marriott. The staff is always very friendly and helpful. The location of this hotel isn't close to anything. I usually rent a car or use a car service, but this year I took a cab downtown to meet friends. The cab ride took forever and cost about 40.00. This wouldn't be much of an issue if there were places to go around the hotel, but there isn't anything but fast food and a CVS. The hotel and the staff are great, but make sure you have some sort of transportation if you want to explore Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expect from marriott”
Reviews.Author: Kytraveltrio
Reviews.Content: There was construction during our stay which was noisy and inconvenient. The beds were not the usual Marriott beds and were uncomfortable. Walls are paper thin you can hear conversations from other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good, refurbished rooms - usual Marriott standard - used for business”
Reviews.Author: T444NJB
Reviews.Content: Not by my choice but stayed for business as a guest and user of conference facilities - slick conference operation as you might expect and, due to recent refurb, the rooms are clean & comfortable. So, good for business not for pleasure, certainly not for romance!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money.”
Reviews.Author: NotHappy1028
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just got back from a two night stay at this hotel. The hotel was under construction, the atmosphere was less than desireable for the price you pay per night. Due to the construction conditions, they should have a discounted rate per night. At $169/night you somewhat expect good treatment. My family and I stay frequently at hotels throughout the Indiana & Michigan area so I do know something about hotels. I was appalled at how we were treated. We arrived at the hotel late, warning...don't do that! The night crew at the front desk was not courteous or willing to help at all. I was like we we were bothering them. Hello...by staying at their hotel, they have a pay check, couldn't they be nicer? We weren't rude! We could have stayed somewhere else! This was our first time at this hotel, we needed to ask some questions regarding the amenities this hotel offered, the front desk clerks were extremely rude. The night bellman was very helpful and showed us around. We ate at the restaurant, which was just a make-shift restaurant stuck in one of the banquet halls. The atmosphere wasn't pleasant, however, the food was excellent. Another thing, we had to pay for internet service. What! Yes, we had to pay $10 for internet service. This was absolutely ridiculous, other hotel's offer it free. At check out, the day front desk clerk and the day bellman were very nice and helpful. I feel sorry for them because they deserve a better review. For the price you pay per night in this hotel, you can find better (overall) treatment at less expensive hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Meetings and Business Events”
Reviews.Author: FLJ021251
Reviews.Content: I just stayed one night at the Marriott-East and this was probably my tenth stay at this hotel. This Marriott caters to conventions and meetings so it is usually pretty crowded, especially in the day time. As several people indicated the hotel is under major reconstruction causing some difficulty with entering the hotel. The management has set up a temporary check-in desk and the restaurant seems to change to a different location each day. The biggest problem with the reconstruction is that there is no signage directing customers to where to check into the hotel. After arriving to the hotel I had to call the hotel from the parking lot to ask where to check in to the hotel. Because of the numerous meetings the parking lot is usually very crowded making it difficult to find a parking space. The hotel is in a perfect location with free parking and numerous restaurants are nearby. The employees at the Marriott are very helpful providing directions and offering suggestions for dinner. When checking in I was offered a suite in the newly renovated tower section of the hotel. However, since this is away from the Club Lounge, I decided to stay in the older section of the hotel that has not yet been renovated. The room was dated, but the trade off was not having to come down the elevators and walk across the hotel for the evening refreshments or morning breakfast. I do think the strength of this hotel is it staff. They are very helpful providing information about local restaurants and other attractions. When leaving the hotel, the manager took time to provide me directions out of the city where I would encounter the least traffic. I was told that construction will be completed by the end of December. I am sure once the renovation is completed this will be an ever more wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Construction going on and room had some issues...Might go again..Maybe...”
Reviews.Author: honeymoonin
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an overnight stay at this hotel and I must say that I was not impressed. Construction seemed to affect too much of the hotel and was not mentioned anywhere on their site. I booked the room last minute using Marriott Reward points and it just was not worth the points with the issues we had. Pros: 1. Marriott Pillowtop bed and bedding are always great. (Murphy bed is not a marriott bed) 2. Liked the shower (all tile and really low entry level) 3. Flat screen TV's in the suite Cons: 1. Construction going on which seemed to affect everything we saw. 2. Guaranteed a 2 double room but one of the beds was a Murphy bed which was not mentioned at check in. Sounds like thats all they had. 3. Check in was a temporary counter which looked very UN-Marriott. 4. No C-lounge on weekends and had to ask for the breakfast benefit (pro: which they happily provided) 5. Toilet didnt flush. The chain fell off inside. I fixed with a paperclip instead of waiting on maintenance as it was very late. 6. Murphy bed foot support swings down but one side was not attached. Again, just made it work instead of packing up the family at such a late hour. 7. Connecting room on both sides. Never seen that before... 8. Breakfast was setup in a conference room. Also temporary because the restaurant was closed for construction and not very good quality. Service was great. Bottom line is that the hotel is mainly a meeting and convention center and staying there during meetings would be understandable. The stay was not horrible and I have to imagine that it will be better after construction is completed. The bed provided a good nights rest. Aside from that, the points would be better served at a real Marriott downtown. Sorry Marriott East, but I am disappointed in you. :(

Reviews.Title: “Average quality”
Reviews.Author: desita01
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable but the air conditioner was old and noisy. Bathroom tub was clogged.

Reviews.Title: “Not a hotel that is up to Marriot standards”
Reviews.Author: Escott_73
Reviews.Content: We were attending the MotoGP races at the racetrack and chose this hotel as a good alternative between the track and relatives in Greenfield. The hotel is under renovations currently and the staff does a good job working around that issue. The real issue is 1. Paper thin walls allowed even conversations in normal tones to be heard in the next room. 2. Antiquated Air Conditioning wall units that sounded like cement mixers making it very difficult to sleep. 3. Outdated bathroom with uncomfortable shower. 4. The bar is extremely expensive. On the good side 1. Good food, if priced a bit high 2. Good breakfast buffet

Reviews.Title: “Under construction - Good luck finding the entrance”
Reviews.Author: Elaine D
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I did not want to stay at a Marriott! It was confusing to find at night (there is a Fairfield Inn nearby with Marriott displayed prominently and confusing entrances). The neighborhood seemed sketchy (it was at night, and our first time there). Once we found an entrance to drive in, it was not clear where the hotel entrance was. No signs! The most activity appeared to be near the conference center entrance, so we tried it. There was no one at the door, and a complicated sign inside showed where the reservations desk was. After a twelve hour drive, in the pouring rain, I had higher hopes for our stay. The room was fine, but the whole experience left me jaded.

Reviews.Title: “Theft from a black guy, unsecured and irresponsible. Be careful. You are not safe.”
Reviews.Author: NOWAYTOBE
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you how sucks this hotel is. My suitcase was stolen from one black guy at a parking lot very early in the morning. I was terribly scared and shocked. At that time, Marriott said my loss would be compensated by an insurance company. Now, 2 months later, they are saying Marriott is not responsible for Guests' security at the parking lot. So no compensation and just compensation for miscommunication. This is a manager's response. "We are not responsible for lost or stolen items in the parking area like a mall. There are a few signs in the parking area that state this as well." It sucks and they are saying Marriott is treating guests like people for shopping in a mall.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good one night stay except...”
Reviews.Author: dingbaobao
Reviews.Content: The airconditioner was really noisy outside the window. We stay at Room 101,right next to that big compressor. The room is clean and the bed is comfortable. Bathroom is really small. The pool water was cold, the hot tub jet didn't work, but the water was warm enough. Internet is not free in the room. We got this from priceline for a cheap price consider that night was booked by Indy 500.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, decent room”
Reviews.Author: ttraveling
Reviews.Content: Hotel looks a bit dated from the outside but inside everything is updated. Bed was quite comfortable, bathroom was spotless. Didn't have a chance to enjoy the pool or exercise room but both seemed spacious compared to many hotels. Service in the bar was painfully slow on a crowded Saturday night, but otherwise the staff was quite friendly and welcoming. Food was good, both the catered meals and the breakfast buffet in the restaurant. Only downside is no free Internet access in the guest rooms, only in the lobby. The hotel is located in a not-so-nice part of town so I wouldn't use it as a base for exploring Indy, but for a self-contained meeting or a stop on the road, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: siren913
Reviews.Content: We were visiting family in the area and got a great deal on this hotel. I was expecting it to be dumpy and gross, but it was far from that. The staff was cheerful and helpful and the courtyard area was lovely. It was a surprise that the hotel had a bar, which we needed after long days of visiting with family :) Some reviewers complain about the noise, which is our complaint as well. We stayed while hundreds of high-schoolers were here and had to step out of the room early in the morning to ask them to keep it down as they were SO loud in the halls and their room, and the doors and walls are thin. If we were to stay here again, I'd request a room at the end of a hallway. We had one issue with a slow-draining shower the first morning that was fixed by the engineering team immediately. This must be the best hotel in the area - recommended.

Reviews.Title: “not best for business”
Reviews.Author: goingawayRI
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel but for the money they charge they really should throw in internet service for free!  even their sister hotel across the way (fairfield) has free internet.  they also charge for local call as well.  no frig, no micro in room.  tv didn't get very many good stations.  lots of news and sports stations.  i did like the comfortable bed and desk area though and the hotel itself is a lot more secure and safe than others i've stayed at in the area. (it is a horrid area to be in).  the pool was extremely small but the exercise room was great.   nice outdoor area too.  i will not be staying here anymore for my business travel.  the price is outrageous and there are more adequate places around there for much less.

Reviews.Title: “Improved”
Reviews.Author: bbrown3333
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year for a conference and was not impressed. This year I attended the same conference and was impressed by the hotel service and improvements. I wish I had had time to enjoy the large sunny courtyard. It has a big waterfall and several fountains that have fires on top at night. There are many chairs and chaises to enjoy the sun, and the indoor pool is adjacent to it. I did not have time to use the fitness center either but it looked spacious and clean, and overlooked the courtyard. The service is friendly and excellent; I was surprised when I returned to my room with leftovers from dinner and asked if there was anyplace I could keep it cool, and they brought me a refrigerator at no extra charge! I would give this hotel five stars, but they still charge for internet in the room which I really dislike, and it is also not in the best part of town. There are several chain restaurants within a mile or two, but they are a little hard to find, even with a GPS. Otherwise, I will be happy to stay here again. the hotel is only 8 miles from Keystone which has upscale shops and restaurants. Marriott beds are fantastic and I slept better than I usually do in hotels. The room has a very nice flat screen tv and this year they have added a fabulous shower head that makes you feel like you are standing in a big rainstorm. they do have free wifi in the lobby but that is not always convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious guest rooms and meeting rooms, beautiful courtyard”
Reviews.Author: logcabinlady
Reviews.Content: This hotel had clean, spacious guest rooms with comfortable bedding and modern ammenities. The staff members throughout the hotel and restaurant were friendly and helpful. There were plenty of large and smaller banquet/conference rooms. My favorite thing about the hotel was the large, gorgeous courtyard. There were at least half a dozen fire pits throughout the courtyard and in the fountain and lots of comfortable chairs and tables. The restaurant food was good, and they served breakfast, lunch and dinner and offered a full bar. My only complaint was the $9.95 per day charge for internet usage (as most of the hotels I have been to in the last several years have provided free internet access). The hotel does have a fitness center and a rather small indoor pool and hot tub, but I can't really comment on them as I didn't get a chance to use them. They also have a gift shop beside the front desk that sells snacks and toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Leeroy8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! I was here for 3 nights, attending a convention. The staff at the front desk were lovely and helpful, and check-in was quick and easy. My room was HUGE, and gorgeous! There was so much space, a king sized bed, large flat screen tv, internet access, plus a hair dryer, ironing board, coffee maker and other amenities. Beautifully decorated, and I had a beautiful view of the courtyard below. I didn't use the pool, but it was indoors and heated. The gym was great, and there were computers in the lobby with free internet access. Internet in the rooms cost $9.95 a day - that was my only complaint (I like free internet included in the room!) The staff here were just wonderful - they were always so cheerful, and they greeted me every time they saw me, which made my stay feel just that little bit nicer! I highly recommend this hotel. I had a wonderful 3 day stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: memelia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is alright but definitely overpriced. Beds are fluffy and sheets are very nice. The rooms have flat screen televisions with HD; however, there are like 10 ESPN channels, HBO and nothing else! No MTV, BET, Bravo, Tvland or E! The hotel is clean but like previous reviews stated very old. Many signs of wear and tear. Rooms and bathrooms are not spacious at all. Bathroom is about the size of a stall at a restaurant. The walls are thin and I could hear drunk people yelling, screaming and slamming doors all night long! Also, a band started playing at around 7 am Sunday morning! It was sooo loud and annoying! The fitness center was totally busted. Half of the televisions did not work and only ESPN or news channels there, NO REMOTES! Half of the equipment was broken the other half will break soon. The staff was friendly but the hotel could use a lot of work. The restaurant buffet breakfast was very good, but some say expensive...not sure. Definitely would not stay here again because of the condition, lack of television channels and noise.

Reviews.Title: “Second time here - both times good”
Reviews.Author: Darr0n
Reviews.Content: The hotel's nice, the inner courtyard renovation is finished and it's very nice. It's close to where I was having my meetings, so for me the location was great, but not if you want to be downtown or don't have a car. Dislikes: not in a rough neighborhood, but close to it; HAVE TO PAY FOR INTERNET - I avoid Marriots because of that, but internet is free in the lobby; in room internet connection was flaky; loud heating/cooling unit in the room; Likes: the courtyard; nice staff; hotel is in good shape

Reviews.Title: “Consider for your next business convention!”
Reviews.Author: RozesOfSharon
Reviews.Content: Our national convention was held at this Marriott East Convention Center on East 21st street. They did a fabulous job, and we weren't an easy group to handle. The convention accomodations were wonderful. The staff was hard working, eager to please. The only regret was that you did not offer double queen rooms. Thank you MARRIOTT for a wonderful yearly event for us!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: momof3indiana
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got this room from Priceline for an excellent price. We were in Indy for a Colts game and while it is about a 10 minute ride to the stadium, it was close enough. We had gone downtown the night before and everything was packed with people. Because of that, we were glad to not be staying closer! The reviews on here are horrible and I was really worried before we got to the hotel. We were very happy with it though. Our room was MUCH bigger than an average hotel room and looked to be recently remodeled. Our bed was comfortable and the large shower was a nice change from the basic tub/shower combo. We had a nice flatscreen tv and a mini fridge included in our room. This place is huge though so be prepared to walk to the bar/restaurant if you are in the back of the hotel. We ordered breakfast room service and it was delivered exactly when promised. While not great, it sufficed. I would stay here again for a game. It was close enough to drive, but far enough from all the action that it was very quiet. Our room was really nice and we were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot recommend...”
Reviews.Author: venividiboggli
Reviews.Content: This was an average hotel and I agree with the previous reviews that said it was sub-par for a Marriott. The worst things about this hotel were that: 1) the air conditioning unit in the room was incredibly loud (and we were told to run the noisier fan continuously to "cover" the sound); 2) the roof leaked during a major rain storm and my son slipped on the wet cement stairs; 3) this hotel is in the outskirts of town and not near anything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!!”
Reviews.Author: JeanneV
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay after reading the reviews on this site, but I was pleasantly surprised!! The room was large and comfortable, especially the wonderful Marriott bed! The conference center was nicely appointed; the hotel staff was especially helpful, Henry is a legend! The food in the restaurant was wonderful, and I had a very nice time! I would recommend this hotel to any conference event. Only 2 cons: it was too far from downtown Indianapolis to venture out, and the beautiful patio area wasn't quite finished! Other than that, thanks for a nice stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced - This shouldn't be considered a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Angela_from_PA
Reviews.Content: The hotel wasn't too hard to find (It's a confusing area with 2 major highway meeting there), but it is definately an old hotel. My mom & I went to a family wedding & I was rather disappointed with the hotel. Everything seemed outdated. Parking was IMPOSSIBLE to find. The beds are comfy but our room was one of the smallest rooms I have ever stayed in. The bathroom has no room in it at all. I would recommend either spending less money & going to a Comfort Inn or spend the same amount & go somewhere else where you actually get what you paid for. In terms of the resturant, we ordered room service the 1st morning since it was pouring down rain. Not only was the food so so, they forgot to bring us silverware. Overall this somewhere I would never stay again....not worth the price at all!

Reviews.Title: “This is a Marriott?”
Reviews.Author: spinkick
Reviews.Content: Finding this place was a bit difficult at first. The brick sign and waterfountains were inpressive but the building itself was very dated. The staff was friendly and helpful-gave me a disposeable toothpaste pack since I forgot mine. But they did fail to warn me that the last bus from downtown was 7pm! You defiantly need a car here to go anyplace. Was close to the event I was attending but way off from any of the attractions. There is no airport shuttle. There was the promised fridge but there was 2" of ice in the freezer. The bathroom was so small that you could wash your hair in the shower while sitting on the toilet. I ran out of toilet paper one night. The room next door had flying ants the first night and by the 3rd the sick any dying ones were crawling into my room. The down comforters and feather pillows were great but there was short black hairs all over the 'decorator' pillows. Internet access in the rooms is by network cable for $$$ but wireless and free in the lobby.. The net is as common as ice cubes today so i think this is unfair. There was a webtv unit available but i didn't try it. Pay per view movies were overpriced for the selection-more pron that regular. Somebody was always fussing about yet a DR Pepper can sat for 2 days on top of the ATM. The restaurant was only so so and the breakfast was way overpriced. The bartender ad difficulties with tropiclal drinks. There was a groundskeeper yet the windows were so dirty that i found my parking place each day by drawing a star in the dirt on the slider door. The pool/courtyard was being renovated but we were allowed to use the one at the Fairfield which was fair. The highlight was the roosting duck in the flowerpots-3 newly hatched ducklings! There are several restaurants and gas stations within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - the service and care to the guests.”
Reviews.Author: MEETINGSOFSUCCESS
Reviews.Content: You are greeted by every employee with smiles and "How can I hep you's" - everyone really takes the time to care about you and your stay. The updates they have done in the meeting space are awesome...no other hotel has the layout of meeting rooms that this hotels does. As a meeting coordinator this is huge in selecting somewhere that you can make sure your guests are taken care of and can find their way to the meetings. The bedroms are awesome - many of my guests couldn't believe how well they could sleep...me too. The fod in the restaurant was off the charts for hotel food as well as our meals we had as a group. The best thing is we will be having our event there again next year and this hotel is only getting better - they ar ereconstructing the swimming pool and outside courtyard and the sketches sow it s going to be a place that you will want to hang out and relax at all the time!!! I can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “No rest for the weary”
Reviews.Author: Whiskeychick
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in this hotel. The pool was closed due to renovation, which was an inconvenience, but the whole place needs fixing up. The air conditioner woke me up every time it went on all night and it was so loud that you couldn't hear the tv or have a conversation over the noise. The bed was okay except for the pillows, which looked big and fluffy, but squashed down to nothing when you used them. Even with the senior citizen discount, we paid $177 for this room and that was far too much for what we got. No breakfast was included either. Save yourself some money and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: seashll59
Reviews.Content: A group of over 600 women stayed at the Marriott Indianapolis East for a state convention. The staff was friendly, efficient, and knowledgeable. Especially, Henry the Bell Captain! The meeting rooms were spacious and comfortable. There were even ample restrooms for 600 women on a break at the same time. The rooms were updated, clean and comfortable. Love those beds! The common areas were well kept. For an older hotel, it is very well maintained. I wonder if some people whow have reviewed were even in the same hotel? Once the pool update is finished, there will also be lovely outdoor sitting areas.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, should be a best western, not a marriott!”
Reviews.Author: briank373
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently at this location, due to the fact that I was attending a convention at this location. The front desk staff were awesome, and Harry the Bellman was great. The hotel on the otherhand, was old, outdated, and I was shocked that it was a marriott. I looks like it should be an old Holiday Inn that was converted to a Days Inn or Best Western. The Bathroom was small, and the shower was cheap and old. No one at the convention was happy with this hotel. Bottom line, is that it's not horrible, but it should not be a Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “The OK and the Not So OK”
Reviews.Author: ProPoke
Reviews.Content: This property is more like a 2 3/4 star but that isn't an option. First the good. Even though this is definately an older property, the room wasn't bad. It's large enough and the bed is comfortable. It's got a CRT TV but it is probably a 25 inch, maybe a 27. It's large enough and there are plenty of channels. Check in was fine. The lady who checked us in was very nice. There is an indoor pool and an indoor hot tub by the pool. 20 oz sodas are available from machines for $1.50 I believe. It may have been $1.25 but I think it was $1.50. I've seen smaller sodas sold for much more at hotels. The air conditioning unit in the room wasn't real quiet but it wasn't real loud either. I'm glad it wasn't any louder but it was okay. Now for the not so good. In the bathroom, I could easier hear people in the next room. I couldn't hear them when I was in the living area, only the bathroom. There is no fan in the bathroom so after a shower, the mirror of course is fogged up for awhile. The elevators aren't the fastest in the world and thankfully there weren't too many people staying there so we never had to wait. I could see where it could become very backed up if there were numerous people staying there. We stayed on a weekend and the free breakfast is not served on weekends but for $9.95, you can have breakfast in the restaurant. Room service ends at 11:00. We ordered room service one night and the lady demanded payment immediately which was not a big deal. However, she didn't have change so I gave her $30.00 and she stated she would leave the change at the front desk. The next morning, I went to the front desk and she had kept $5.00 for herself. She didn't leave any change at the front desk nor did she even turn the ticket in to the front desk. It's as if I never ordered room service. Thankfully, the front desk staff did give me my change but if this employee will attempt to steal funds from customers, it makes me wonder what else she would attempt? The food was okay, nothing special. It's convienent, that is the best part of the restaurant located here. All in all, this hotel is okay. Above average in some areas and below average in some areas. When Comfort Inns and Holiday Inn Express offers free breakfast on weekends and this place can't, that is below average. Room service staff trying to steal money from customers, that is unacceptable. If you are looking for a professional, full service hotel, you can do better than this. If you are looking for something a little nicer than an economy hotel, this fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “I won't be back”
Reviews.Author: braumeister
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation at the Fairfield Inn next door, but they "upgraded" me to the Marriott when I arrived. I think I would have been better off if they had let me stay at the Fairfield. There were several conventions going on at the Marriott, so there were crowds in every hallway and the elevator service was really slow. They put me in one of their better rooms on the top floor, but I can't say I was happy. The bathroom configuration was so awkward that you had to be a contortionist to reach the toilet paper roll, the vent fan didn't work, so the mirror got totally steamed up when you finished your shower. The faucet in the sink ran constantly unless you adjust it just precisely right. The typical Marriott practice of an extra $10 a day for internet access has always been ridiculous, but I was able to avoid it this time by using the free wireless signal from the nearby Days Inn. Take that, Marriott! Aside from the standard Marriott deal of a good comfortable bed and three times as many pillows as you can use, there is no good reason to use the chain, and this was NOT a great stay. The air conditioning unit was so loud, and the conversations from adjoining rooms through the paper-thin walls was so annoying that I actually had to use my earplugs to get a decent night's sleep. I'll never be back here, that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: winkyjrp
Reviews.Content: First off let me start by saying I soley depended on these reviews to make a decision where to stay in Indy, so I will be as thorough as I can. Hopefully my review will help others as they have helped me. My family and I went to Indy for a weekend getaway and wanted to stay and a nice, well priced hotel. We chose the double room package that included breakfast each morning. The total with taxes ended up to be around $130.00 a night, but it was well worth it to me. The breakfast is located in the hotel near the lobby called Indy Rib House (or something like that) It boasts to have the best Ribs in town although we did not get the chance to sample any. The breakfast is a buffet, not continental. They had eggs, bacon, sausage, grits, hash browns, fresh fruit, cereal, bagels,etc. They even had someone there to make waffles and omlettes. The food was delicious. The hotel itself is very clean and well kept. The rooms were spacious and very comfortable. The beds were the most comfortable I think I have ever slept on(the pillows,too) For the people who like to check their email everyday, they have a complimentary computer in their business center that is free access to the internet for 15 minutes. The staff was nice and friendly and very accomodating. The hotel is in an area that is near highways and many different restaurants in the area. I would choose Marriott Indy East to stay the next time I visit this city.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, stay away from the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: cahilllaw
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and had the great mattresses that Marriott seems to be putting in to most of its rooms. The upgrades that have been noted in other reviews have made this a nice hotel to stay in, but stay away from the restaurant. Food was mediocre and inconsistent. My wife's baked potato was so hard and cold that it would not melt butter. The server was very sweet and tried to see if we could get part of my wife' s meal comp'ed. Manager who came over looked at us like we were trying to pull something and tried to shove a free desert on us instead. We didn't really want one and would have preferred, given her attitude that she would have just left us alone.

Reviews.Title: “Totally satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: lcloud
Reviews.Content: DIAMOND IN THE ROUGH! (Please note, they are going through some construction, but are VERY accommodating) I had booked 3 rooms at the Hampton Inn across the street from this Marriott. (See my review on Hampton Inn East) Long story short, the Hampton Inn cancelled my reservations due to my having an Indianapolis address. (again, read my review) Anyway, I contacted the Marriott directly and they went above and beyond for my group! 3 rooms, same floor, 2 connecting. Rooms were very clean and spacious. We had a total of 16 people and it worked out just fine. They have upgraded their bedding and toiletries and are giving Starwood a run for their money! (I travel a lot for business and am a "Starwood Snob") Plenty of towels and toiletries for our entire group. Pool area was great for the kids (ages 8-9, girls) There is both an indoor and outdoor that are connected (seasonal) and there is a very large sitting area with patio tables for the parents to watch. We held an impromptu birthday party for one of the girls in the pool area and there was plenty of room. Bar was small but the bartender was great. Drinks were reasonably priced. Dining: The Marriott comp'd our breakfasts (~$150). They have a buffet with made to order omlets, waffles, and such. They gave us our own private dining area. (On Sundays they have a large brunch.) They are in the midst of some construction to improve the facility. Other than that, they were a great choice for us and I will recommed them in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel”
Reviews.Author: skyeport
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March for only one night. Normally when I am in this area I stay at the Fairfield Inn also in the Marriott Center. However, it was sold out the night I was staying. The Marriott was undergoing renovation and I think the room I stayed in had already been renovated, as far as a new bed and bedding. I had a king room, on the fourth floor which was a concierge floor, but of course the lounge was closed on the weekend. The bed was very comfortable and all the amenities in the room wonderful--nice shampoo, lotion, and a sewing kit (I usually stay in Courtyards or Fairfields so I'm not used to these items being in rooms). The bathroom was small, but I had no problems with this--the shower head provided a nice massaging shower. The restaurant's food was ok. I had dinner and breakfast, no major complaints. The only problem I had was upon checkin--the lady may have been overworked, but she was not at all friendly. There was a nice pool and exercise center, though I didn't use it. As long as you don't pay too much for this hotel, I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Showing it's age”
Reviews.Author: rockchalktraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property one night on our way back from a Maine vacation. This property is definitely showing its age. The ceilings were very low and the place has a very closed design would would indicate its advanced age. The rooms were average. The staff was friendly however and when I inquired about an upgraded room (I am a Platinum member) I was told due to an American Legion convention that no suites were available. They did accomodate me with one of the rooms available with their new massage chairs and that was great! On checking in we had to dodge a couple dozen drunken American Legionnaires but this was no fault of the Marriott. The value was O.K. but I would definitely spend my money across the parking lot at the much newer and nicer Fairfield Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it”
Reviews.Author: ficoguy
Reviews.Content: Well, they have these air conditioning units on the wall, the kind that you find in a Motel 6 - they are supposed to be thermostatically cpntrolled, but they aren't. I was tjere fpr 2 nights 8/2to 8/3 this year - your choice is to cut the noise and sweat like a pig, or hear the roar of the air unit all night long. I chose to sleep quietly, but sweat. The room never got below 84 degrees. One morning, they forgot my room service order - I'm waiting patiently, finally call, and thet say they never got it ( it's the kind you ahng off the door ). They did nothing to resolve or address the room temperature conditions, because they were sold out. They did offer to send up a fan, so I could move the hot air around and have even more noise. This place must be very old, because there is no HVAC system on the rooms - only the Motel 7 wall units. What a nigtmare. I checked out a day early and went home. Also, the Concierge floor is a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing too exciting about this place”
Reviews.Author: cdfev
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that I have stayed here over the last several years. It's okay...rooms are a little below the standard Marriott...the place is probably 40 years old. The pool is okay. The bar area is okay. The service is a little uninterested. Rates are usually good as compared to any of the other full service name brand hotels. I wouldn't go out of my way to stay here but it is fine for a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “amenities okay, but service lacking”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott East Sept. 11 - 13, 2004. I found the hotel to be okay, but service was so-so, and the stay did not live up to my hopes. First, I arrived with a confirmed reservation for a room with king bed. I was assigned a room with two queens. I came from California, so this was a bother at the end of a long travel day. (As an aside, the hotel is hard to find at night when coming from the east, another bother at the end of a long travel day.) Then, however, I was "upgraded" to one of the so-called Concierge Floor rooms. That should have meant the lounge on the 4th floor would be available to me. When I went up there on Sunday night, though, the reception was anythng but friendly. A man and a woman were lounging there watching TV, and I guess they must have been the Concierge staff because they questioned, "What do you want?" in a not very nice manner. At that point, I was mostly looking to see if I could find the computer "hot spot" the hotel supposedly had. I had no luck in the lounge so I tried the lobby. I had no luck there either. I believe the service just was not working correctly. All in all, everything was adequate, but I disagree with a prior posted review about great service. My experience was that the service was lacking, especially considering the prices.

Reviews.Title: “great stay, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my family and i attended a air show convention in indianapolis, the banquet was held at this hotel. The guest rooms were great and clean, the food was great. the swimming pool was very cold but we got used to it. we stayed there for 3 days. and enjoyed every one of them at the marriot east. we will be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “The Indpls Marriott East is the Best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Marriott East in Indianapolis, I won't ever stay anyplace else in the city! The rooms are beautiful, the service is incredible and the people are the friendliest, most helpful I've ever encountered in my travels. I HIGHLY recommend them!

HotelInfo.Name: Marriott Indianapolis East
HotelInfo.Address: 7202 East 21st Street, Indianapolis, IN 46219
